info.title: Exposure API Reference
info.description:
![RedBee](https://redbee.ctl.cdn.ebsd.ericsson.net/imagescaler002/redbee/redbeetv/configimages/d04bb721-fb45-4f9e-9216-9c3a219ef322.png?format=webp&h=50)

### Red Bee Media Pulse Exposure API 

#### Authentication

Many endpoints require an `Authorization` header:

`Authorization: Bearer <sessionToken> `

In the **Swagger UI**,  use the **green Authorize** function below to set the session token.

The `<sessionToken>` is acquired using one of the Login or Session creation endpoints in the [Authentication](#/Authentication) resource section.

In some endpoints an API-key is required in the `EMP-Auth` header.

`EMP-Auth: Basic <keyId:keySecret>` 

`<keyId:keySecret>` is to be Base64Encoded

API keys can be created using the customer portal: [https://redbee.live/portal](https://redbee.live/portal).

Older API keys can also be used in the same way as previous.

#### Data formats

Request and response bodies are always JSON encoded.

In request and response bodies, dates and times are ISO 8601 encoded, e.g. `2022-02-22T22:22:22+00:00`, while in query parameters epoch millis are used.

#### Customer and Business Unit

Most endpoints requires `customer` and `businessUnit` in the path. You can instantiate this documentation for a specific customer and businessUnit using this8 URL:

[https://exposure.api.redbee.live/docs/customer/{customer}/businessunit/{businessUnit}/](https://exposure.api.redbee.live/docs/customer/{customer}/businessunit/{businessUnit}/)

#### Eventsink

The endpoints to report Player analytics events are found here: [https://eventsink.api.redbee.live/docs](https://eventsink.api.redbee.live/docs).

#### Other documentation   

General information of the service can be found at [https://redbee.live/docs/](https://redbee.live/docs/).

Deprecated but still available APIs can be found [here](https://apidocs.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/). It may overlap to some extent with this swagger.

get.summary: Get a thumbnail for an asset.
get.description:
The thumbnail will be generated from the video belonging to the asset and based on
 provided time.
 This endpoint will always return a 307 redirect to another url where the thumbnail is actually available.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description:
The time to use when creating the thumbnail. It can have two different formats. It can be
                     a wall clock time like '2021-02-02T10:53:35.400Z'. This assumes that the
                     asset has a wall clock time. It can also be a duration, like PT30M20S, and
                     then it will be used as an actual time in th video.

400.description:
INVALID_TIME_DURATION. The provided time is not a valid duration.
INVALID_TIME_WALL_CLOCK. The provided time is not a valid wall clock time.

404.description: UNKNOWN_ASSET. If the asset cannot be found.

FORBIDDEN. If this business unit has been configured to require server to server authentication, but it is not valid.
NOT_AVAILABLE. The asset is not available (playable) even if the asset itself is known.
BLOCKED. All play requests for the asset is currently blocked. (for instance blacked out or catchup blocked)
GEO_BLOCKED. Play is not allowed in selected region.
CONCURRENT_STREAMS_LIMIT_REACHED. Play is not allowed due to concurrent streams limitation.
NOT_PUBLISHED. The asset is not published.
NOT_ENTITLED. The user does not have access to play the asset.

get.summary: Do a play call.
get.description: If the entitlement checks pass it will return the information needed to initialize the player.

parameters.name: assetId
parameters.description: The id of the asset to play.

parameters.name: EMP-Auth
parameters.description:
If this business unit has been configured to require server to server
                                 authentication, this
                                 has to be the api key.

parameters.name: X-Adobe-Primetime-MediaToken
parameters.description:
Adobe primetime short-lived media token. Used for verification against adobe
                                 prime
                                 time.

parameters.name: persistent
parameters.description:
To be used if we for one business unit can deliver both persistent and
                                 non-persistent
                                 licenses.

parameters.name: timeShift
parameters.description:
Very special, we can deliver a time shift for smooth. DO NOT USE unless you are
                                 told so.

parameters.name: live
parameters.description:
Use this if you really want to play live and does not care about the epg even if
                                 one exist.
                                 DO NOT USE unless you are told so.

parameters.name: maxResolution
parameters.description:
Use this to filter out higher bitrates. Note that this requires backend
                                 configuration for
                                 your organization.

parameters.name: audioOnly
parameters.description:
Use this with value true if you only want to include audio tracks in the
                                 response.

parameters.name: maxFrameRate
parameters.description: Use this if you want to include only video tracks with a max frame rate.

parameters.name: X-Forwarded-For
parameters.description: Provides the end user IP if there is a proxy in between.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description:
Use this to provide a start time when playing a channel. Should be used when
                                 there is no
                                 epg available.
                                 Format: ISO_DATE_TIME example 2021-01-31T00:00:00Z
                                 Experimental, do not use unless told so.

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description:
Use this to provide an end time when playing a channel. Should be used when there
                                 is no epg
                                 available.
                                 Format: ISO_DATE_TIME example 2021-01-31T00:00:00Z
                                 Experimental, do not use unless told so.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Start time in number of seconds in the playback manifest.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: End time in number of seconds in the playback manifest.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description:
Provide GPS based geo-location for location based ad targeting (optional) e.g.
                                 latitude=33.543682. Used for SSAI.

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description:
Provide GPS based geo-location for location based ad targeting (optional) e.g.
                                 longitude=-86.779633. Used for SSAI.

parameters.name: mute
parameters.description: Indicate whether player is muted or not. Used for SSAI.

parameters.name: consent
parameters.description:
A consent string passed from various Consent Management Platforms (CMPs). Used
                                 for SSAI.

parameters.name: deviceMake
parameters.description: Manufacturer of device such as Apple or Samsung. Used for SSAI.

parameters.name: ifa
parameters.description: User device ID. Used for SSAI.

parameters.name: gdprOptin
parameters.description: A flag for European Union traffic consenting to advertising. Used for SSAI.

parameters.name: appStoreUrl
parameters.description: App store URL. Used for SSAI.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: Channel Partner. Domain where player is embedded. Used for SSAI.

parameters.name: ccpaConsent
parameters.description: A flag for US consent for advertising. Used for SSAI.

parameters.name: supportedFormats
parameters.description:
A comma-separated priority list for supported formats for playback, first value
                                 has highest priority. Supported values are hls, dash, mss, mp3, aac. First value
                                 will
                                 always be used for SSAI.

parameters.name: supportedDrms
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list for supported DRM providers for playback.
                                 Supported values are widevine, fairplay, playready.

parameters.name: limitAdTracking
parameters.description: True if the user opted-out of ad tracking. Used for SSAI.

parameters.name: materialProfile
parameters.description: Provide material profile if you want to play a version used for a specific purpose. You need to know what profile to use.

parameters.name: custom
parameters.description: A comma-seperated list for sending additional custom non-SDK supported SSAI paramaters. Used for SSAI.

400.description:
INVALID_JSON. If JSON received is not valid JSON.
INVALID_START_TIME. Invalid startTime.
INVALID_END_TIME. Invalid endTime.
END_TIME_WITHOUT_START_TIME_IS_NOT_ALLOWED. Only endTime without startTime is not allowed.
START_TIME_MUST_BE_BEFORE_END_TIME. StartTime must be before endTime.
START_TIME_OLD. StartTime is not accepted. It is too old.
START_TIME_OLD_WHEN_NO_END_TIME. StartTime is not accepted. It is too old when no endTime is provided.
START_TIME_IN_THE_FUTURE. StartTime cannot be in the future.
START_END_TIME_DURATION_TO_LONG. The duration between startTime and endTime is to long.

401.description:
NO_SESSION_TOKEN. If the session token is missing.
INVALID_SESSION_TOKEN. If the session token is provided but not valid.
INVALID_ADOBE_AUTH. The provided adobe play token is not valid.

403.description:
FORBIDDEN. If this business unit has been configured to require server to server authentication, but it is not valid.
NOT_AVAILABLE. The asset is not available (playable) even if the asset itself is known.
BLOCKED. All play requests for the asset is currently blocked. (for instance blacked out or catchup blocked)

CONCURRENT_STREAMS_LIMIT_REACHED. Play is not allowed due to concurrent streams limitation.
NOT_PUBLISHED. The asset is not published.
NOT_ENTITLED. The user does not have access to play the asset.

countryCode.description:
In which country this offering is valid, if not present anywhere
Format: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2, if not present the offering is available globally

productOfferingType.description: Type of offering: purchase, rental, event, subscription

percentage.description: The percentage of the price to paid a VAT, e.g. 12.5

included.description: If the VAT is part of the product offering price

methodTypes.description: One entry for each relevant payment method type, such as "card", "ideal"

wallets.description: One entry for each relevant wallet, such as "apple", "google"

ApiStripePaymentMethodTypeAndPrice.description: One entry for each relevant payment method type, such as "card", "ideal"

ApiStripePurchaseRequest.description:
Purchase using Stripe as payment platform.
Creates an stripe intent.
Requires that Stripe is configured for the customer/business unit.

clientSecret.description: If setupCard == false the clientSecret is paymentIntent clientSecret. If setupCard == true the clientSecret is setupIntent clientSecret

setupCard.description: If true setup card else payment

name.description: Name of wallet e.g apple or google

ApiStripeWalletAndPrice.description: One entry for each relevant wallet, such as "apple", "google"

channelId.description: The channel id if the asset was viewed as catchup or live.

errorMessage.description:
Property is set to "FAILURE" if the data couldn't be received.
 If no problem this property is not set.

lastViewedOffset.description: Last viewed offset, offset in the last play of the asset.

programId.description: The program id if the asset was viewed as catchup or live.

type.description:
Name of type
 "boolean":  value range null/undefined, false, true,
 "email": valid email address
 "string": any string
 "integer": integer number e.g 1
 "real": Real/decimal number e.g 1.1

requiredAtSignup.description: If true user must provide value

enums.description: If type = "enum": The enums value set

valueSet.description: If true the attribute has been set, potentially with a null/undefined value, in which case the default value is used

id.description: To be used as value of the enum

title.description: Title of attribute or enum in locale's language.

description.description: The attribute's or enum's description  in locale's language.

canChangePassword.description: True if the user can change password here.

canChangeUserNameAndEmail.description: True if user name equals the user's email address and the user may change this; password required

canChangeEmail.description: True if user name is not equal to the user's email address and the user may change the email address.

canManageAccount.description: True if user can manage user profiles and cancel account

canManageDevices.description: True if user can manage devices

canManagePayments.description: True if user can manage payment methods, such as credit cards

canManagePurchases.description: True if user can manage purchase, such as adding and cancelling subscriptions

displayName.description: Name used e.g. as email display name, null if not changed

child.description: If true the user is a child

profileType.description: Application defined value. Can be used e.g. to carry mapping to parental rating configuration.

displayName.description:
Name used e.g. as email display name, null if not changed.
 If value is not provided any existing value is unchanged.

language.description:
Preferred language.
 If value is not provided any existing value is unchanged.

child.description: True if user is a child.

profileType.description:
Application defined value. Can be used e.g. to carry mapping to parental rating configuration.
 If value is not provided any existing value is unchanged.

lastUpdated.description: Last time the preferences where changed.

child.description: True if user is a child.

profileType.description: Application defined value. Can be used e.g. to carry mapping to parental rating configuration.

active.description: True if this user profile is the active user

owner.description: True if user is owner of the account.

emailAddressRequired.description: DEPRECATED True if the user must have an email address. Check User attribute primary-email-address instead.

attributes.description:
Potentially empty list of attributes
 EXPERIMENTAL May change

child.description: True if user is a child.

profileType.description: Application defined value. Can be used e.g. to carry mapping to parental rating configuration.

pinCodes.description: List of pin codes, which may or may not be related to profile management.

displayName.description: Name used e.g. as email display name

emailAddress.description:
Used for e.g. password reset mails
 Maybe required depending on customer settings
 EmailAddress must be provided

language.description:
Preferred language. If not set fall back to business unit's default language
 Valid iso 639-1 language code

informationCollectionConsentGivenNow.description:
If TRUE consent to information collection is given now
 If FALSE or null no consent given now.

unConfirmed.description:
If TRUE the user need to confirm creation bu following email/sms instructions
 If FALSE the account is good to go.

displayName.description: Name used e.g. as email display name

emailAddress.description:
Used for e.g. password reset mails
 Maybe required depending on customer settings
 EmailAddress must be provided

language.description:
Preferred language. If not set fall back to business unit's default language
 Valid iso 639-1 language code

informationCollectionConsentGivenNow.description:
If TRUE consent to information collection is given now
 If FALSE or null no consent given now.

lastViewedOffset.description:
Only relevant for VOD.
 This is the offset from the start off the VOD is ms

liveTime.description:
Only relevant for LIVE.
 This is the offset from the start of the stream in ms.
 Since we always use unix epoch as start for our channels this will be a UNIX timestamp when the user hit pause while watching live

airplayEnabled.description: Is apple airplay allowed or not

ffEnabled.description: Is the user allowed to fast forward

maxBitrate.description: What is the highest bitrate that should be used

maxResHeight.description: What is the highest resolution allowed

minBitrate.description: What is the lowest bitrate that should be used

rwEnabled.description: Is the user allowed to rewind

timeshiftEnabled.description: Is the user allowed to timeshift (skip)

licenseActivation.description: The datetime of activation of the drm license.

licenseExpiration.description: The datetime of expiration of the drm license.

licenseExpirationReason.description: The reason of expiration of the drm license.

password.description: The password to verify if it's the correct one.

valid.description: If the password was valid or not.

bearer-key.description: Get a sessionToken with any of the [Authentication](#/Authentication) endpoints.
